metadata.feature_description: Configure pagination size for content lists across social modules with options from 5 to 100 items per page.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify dropdown shows all available options

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Community in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Community Settings page loads with Miscellaneous Community Settings section
steps.actual: Community Settings page loaded successfully with Page Size dropdown visible

steps.action: Click on Page Size dropdown to expand options
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all 6 options: 5 items, 10 items, 15 items, 25 items, 50 items, 100 items

steps.action: Check initial value of Page Size dropdown
steps.actual: Page Size dropdown shows '5 items' as the default selected value

steps.action: Select '10 items' from Page Size dropdown
steps.expected: 10 items should be selected in the dropdown
steps.actual: 10 items was successfully selected in the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings should be saved with success message

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save page size and verify persistence

steps.action: Set Page Size to 10 items and save
Navigate away from Community Settings and return
steps.expected: Page Size should still show 10 items (the saved value)
steps.actual: Page Size reverted to default '5 items' - setting did NOT persist

steps.action: Set Page Size to 25 items and save (second attempt)
Navigate away and return to Community Settings
steps.expected: Page Size should show 25 items (the saved value)
steps.actual: Page Size reverted to default '5 items' again - persistence issue confirmed

issues: CRITICAL: Page Size setting does not persist after save. Despite showing 'Item successfully saved' message, the value reverts to default '5 items' when navigating away and returning to the settings page.
Tested with multiple values (10 items, 25 items) - both failed to persist.

observations: The Page Size dropdown UI is correctly implemented with all 6 expected options (5, 10, 15, 25, 50, 100 items).
The Comments Page Size dropdown is also present with the same options.
The Save button triggers correctly and displays a success notification.
Source code files specified in the feature documentation were not available in the repository for code review.
The persistence failure suggests either the backend API is not properly saving the value, or the UI is not properly binding the saved value on page load.
